channel.title: Family who are 'too fat to work' say £22,000 worth of benefits is not enough
channel.description:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/howaboutthat/5004431/Family-who-are-too-fat-to-work-say-22000-worth-of-benefits-is-not-enough.html [center][img]http://www.telegraph.co.uk/telegraph/multimedia/archive/01367/fatfamily_1367600c.jpg[/img][/center]
Philip Chawner, 53, and his 57-year-old wife Audrey weigh 24st. Their daughter Emma, 19, weighs 17st, while her older sister Samantha, 21, weighs 18st. The family from Blackburn claim £22,508 a year in benefits, equivalent to the take-home pay from a £30,000 salary. The Chawners, haven't worked in 11 years, claim their weight is a hereditary condition and the money they receive is insufficient to live on. Mr Chawner said: "What we get barely covers the bills and puts food on the table. It's not our fault we can't work. We deserve more." The family claim to spend £50 a week on food and consume 3,000 calories each a day. The recommended maximum intake is 2,000 for women and 2,500 for men. "We have cereal for breakfast, bacon butties for lunch and microwave pies with mashed potato or chips for dinner," Mrs Chawner told Closer magazine. "All that healthy food, like fruit and veg, is too expensive. We're fat because it's in our genes. Our whole family is overweight," she added. Each week, Mr and Mrs Chawner, who have been married for 23 years, receive £177 in income support and incapacity benefit. Mrs Chawner is paid an extra £330-a-month disability allowance for epilepsy and asthma, both a result of being overweight. Mr Chawner gets £71 a month after developing Type 2 diabetes because of his size. He was on a waiting list for a gastric band last year, but a heart condition made the operation unsuitable. Their daughter Samantha receives £84 in Jobseekers' Allowance each fortnight while Emma, who is training to be a hairdresser, gets £58 every two weeks under a hardship fund for low-income students. Emma, said: "I'm a student and don't have time to exercise" she said "We all want to lose weight to stop the abuse we get in the street, but we don't know how.
Now we know why they were forcing the blonde one on the right into xfactor, despite the fact she couldn't sing.

item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

[quote=“Tree, post:11, topic:268409”]Weight management comes down to the individual. sure, genes play a part but weight can be lost. It’s one of the great things about the human body. How on earth do these lazy people think they are entitled to the tax payers money?

I support Hitler’s idea on survival of the fittest.[/quote]

I agree 100% ^^

Amg mopman 199 rep!

item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:45, topic:268409”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=354229.msg2725133#msg2725133 date=1238280445]

I feel terribly sorry for them. It’s really sad that people live like that.

lol those girls look like they’d pop if you’d jab them with a pin.

How the fuck can you feel sorry for them?! They made them selves like that probably!

If they could’ve changed, they would have done so.
[/quote]
not really, cause this is an excuse for them to do nothing and get money for it[/quote]

Well, had they planned on doing anything to remedy it; they would either already be doing it or have finished by now. Some external source is going to have take action (Something like a show where they go to a boot camp for 6 months would be lulz)

Besides, you can’t possibly think the hordes of angry idiots that roam the web who might happen to live near them are going to let this slide, do you?
